action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller of Illinois (for herself and Mr. Good of Virginia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To prohibit the provision of Federal funds to a local educational agency unless in-person instruction is available to all students at the schools served by the agency.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funds for certain local educational agencies

subsection.text: No Federal funds shall be provided to a local educational agency unless in-person instruction is available to all students at each public elementary school and secondary school under the jurisdiction of the local educational agency.

In this Act, the terms elementary school, local educational agency, and secondary school have the meanings given such terms in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
